POSITION SUMMARY:: The incumbent is a key member of the Asia Pacific Management team, and the Husky Energy Finance team, and is responsible for the short and long term financial health and integrity of the company's Asia Pacific operations, through the safeguarding of its assets and the development/implementation of financial policies, controls and reporting systems that provide accurate and timely financial and management information for business decision-making within the context of such policies and systems used by Husky Energy, the parent company. This position is accountable for the financial management, provision of banking, financing, treasury, tax, credit, and internal audit, for Husky's Asia Pacific operations and will work with the relevant functions at Husky Energy to ensure corporate policies are implemented and complied with. In collaboration with the Chief Operating Officer, VP - Legal, and General Managers of Indonesia and China, the incumbent will support Husky's operations in the Asia Pacific Region. This position will also have strong functional responsibility to the Chief Financial Officer of Husky Energy in respect of financial matters, and the Husky Board of Directors.
responsabilities: Contributing to the achievement of Husky Asia Pacific corporate goals by participating as a member of the Asia Management Team and providing key input from financial, accounting, tax and other perspectives.$$$%%%&&&Safeguarding the assets of Husky Asia Pacific by developing anf ensuring the implementation of policies, systems and internal controls relative to cash disbursements/reciepts, payrolls, inventories and fixed assets that protect shareholer interests.$$$%%%&&&Maintaining sounds and effective financial reporting and control by ensuring that appropriate general accounting, budgeting and management accountability procedures are in place consistent with Husky Energy requirements and followed across Husky Asia Pacific.$$$%%%&&&Providing guidance to the Treasury function to ensure the integrity of Husky's Asia Pacific's cash flow management systems and hedging programs within the context of Husky Energy policies and requirements.$$$%%%&&&Consulting on any significant tax planning/compliance issues as well as adequacy of Husky Asia Pacific's mid and long-term financiang arrangements in respect of capital plans and appropriate realtionships with senior representatives of debt-rating agencies and chartered banks, within the context of Husky Energy policies and requirements$$$%%%&&&Approving the development of an annual operations and financial audit program for Asia Pacific that ensures appropriate procedures and processes are implemented to safeguard Company assets, within the context of Husky Energy policies and requirements.$$$%%%&&&Provide the necesssary support to Husky Energy to meet its reporting and securities obligations in a timely manner.$$$%%%&&&Promoting individual and team performance for assigned portfolios through regular management meetings.$$$%%%&&&Working collaboratively with the Senior HR Manager and Country Managers of Indonesia to ensure the hiring of competent financial staff and effective succession plans.

CA_REQD: Masters or Business Degreee with an accounting or finance designation or related post-secondary education in relevant field from internationally recognized university

POSITION SUMMARY:: The job incumbent will apply independent judgment to provide a full range of high level secretarial and administrative support to the Chief Financial Officer and the team in a professional, confidential, effective and efficient manner. Also, this incumbent will be providing secretarial and clerical support to the Head of Corporate Services and the Marketing Director or any other executives assigned.
responsabilities: Read and screen incoming correspondence and reports; make preliminary assessment of the importance of the materials, forward appropriate materials to the executives or respond properly for the purpose of providing information, facilitating communication among parties, and/or providing direction$$$%%%&&&Receive and screen incoming calls and visitors, take messages from external or internal sources so that callers/visitors are dealt with promptly, courteously and accurately$$$%%%&&&Manage the executives’ appointments and schedules, make travel arrangements to make best use of their time; prepare, compile and maintain travel vouchers and records$$$%%%&&&Plan, co-ordinate and organize business meetings and professional conferences, include scheduling meeting times, arranging travel bookings for attendances, ensuring amenities, equipment, food and drinks are available$$$%%%&&&Prepare agenda and collect materials for meetings and conferences; take minutes and keeps records of proceedings$$$%%%&&&Research, gather, compile, verify and analyse information for the executives to use in documents such as memos, letters, reports, speeches, presentations and news releases.$$$%%%&&&Act as a liaison to facilitate smooth communications between the management, executives, shareholder representatives, employees and external parties such as business partners, investors, banks and government authorities.$$$%%%&&&Handle confidential information and maintain the security of the executives’ files and records $$$%%%&&&Handle invoices, complete expenses reports and maintain proper records; monitor and review standard expenditures to ensure that activities are conducted within established budgets$$$%%%&&&Prepare documents and presentation materials, draft letters and official information releases, produce reports, charts and graphs.$$$%%%&&&Document activities, maintain a wide variety of computerized and manual files, records and related information, ensure up-to-date reference trail and reliable information provided$$$%%%&&&Review and proofread documents prepared for the executive’s signature$$$%%%&&&Perform other administrative duties using independent judgment and discretion$$$%%%&&&Assist in any other assigned duties and ad hoc projects as and when required$$$%%%&&&Plan, organise, prioritize and schedule own workload to ensure all these activities are completed timely and accurately

Position Title:: Senior Human Resources Manger, Asia Pacific

POSITION SUMMARY:: This position provides work direction and leadership for a small team of accounting technicians. This role is a suitable progression for a junior to intermediate accountant or senior technician to gain leadership experience through participation in employee development, performance management and handling decision making, problem solving and analytics. This role is responsible for ensuring the effectiveness of incoming cash processes and will lead process improvements within the team.
responsabilities: Lead and mentor a team of 5 accounting technicians whose main responsibilities are processing of incoming payments and application of cash.$$$%%%&&&Provide work direction and coordination for the team to ensure timely completion of work with multiple daily deadlines.$$$%%%&&&Develop realistic plans and integrate plans with other teams. Coordinate the smooth flow of timely, accurate and high quality information to others.$$$%%%&&&Identify opportunities for change, make recommendations for improvements, act as a catalyst for change and stimulate others to change within day to day operations. Manage implementation effectively.$$$%%%&&&Prepare monthly reporting, reconciliations and associated journal entries. Analyze variances and provide analysis and explanation.$$$%%%&&&Provide information, reports and analyses.$$$%%%&&&Provide input on accounting policies and practices.$$$%%%&&&Communicate with banks and service providers to ensure the flow of information and settlement of accounts.$$$%%%&&&Analyze and reconcile assigned accounts to ensure timely cash application.$$$%%%&&&Research problems, answer inquiries, follow-up on outstanding issues with various departments and outside companies for prompt settlement.$$$%%%&&&Develop and maintain a high level of knowledge of cash, AR and incoming payment processes.$$$%%%&&&Understand and monitor SOX controls$$$%%%&&&Liaise with Operations, Credit and Finance staff to resolve problems and coordinate receipt of information$$$%%%&&&Respond to requests and participate in ad hoc projects as required.

POSITION SUMMARY:: This position is responsible for coordinating, developing and delivering training programs and courses for the Finance and Accounting groups. The position requires a strong background in training and employee development as well as having experience as an accountant or finance professional. The role includes responsibility for administration of Husky's designation training offices and liaison with students, mentors, training principals and line managers to track progress of students in developing requisite skill sets.
responsabilities: Work with the finance and accounting teams to develop training curriculums and catalogues specific to the needs of each group and for each of the designation training offices.$$$%%%&&&Monitor and evaluate effectiveness of training programs.$$$%%%&&&Build and deliver training courses designed for Finance and Accounting staff and users of finance and accounting processes.$$$%%%&&&Develop and maintain relationships with training institutions and service providers as well as engaging them in developing Finance and Accounting training programs.$$$%%%&&&Develop and maintain recruiting and training schedules, student tracking processes, program documentation and skill matrices as well as communication tools for training offices.$$$%%%&&&Coordinate on campus recruiting and assist with student screening and selection.$$$%%%&&&Develop processes for newly established training offices and ensure that they receive administrative support.$$$%%%&&&Coordinate funding of Finance and Accounting training programs and manage budgets for training offices.$$$%%%&&&Work together with HR to establish a mentorship program and framework and develop mentors within the Finance and Accounting organization. Develop designation specific training programs for mentors within the training offices.$$$%%%&&&Work with HR to rollout new Learning Management System and establish standing operating procedures for tracking skills and qualifications.$$$%%%&&&Act as a career coach for Finance and Accounting employees.$$$%%%&&&Assist with Talent Management program development, delivery and administration for Finance and Accounting.

POSITION SUMMARY:: In this role, you will be responsible for providing work direction, lead the development and support of 6 accountants and accounting technicians. In addition, complete Key Performance Indicators (KPI) reporting and perform associated analysis. This position will also support initiatives within the team such as process improvements, projects and problem solving.
responsabilities: Establishing a learning culture by providing leadership, mentorship, and learning opportunities to 6 accountants and accounting technicians$$$%%%&&&The team main responsibilities are Credit Card data balancing between internal and external networks, master data setup, SMS and SAP interface, SAP AR account set up, downstream non-trade vendor set up, accounting support to the Lubricant and Marketing groups utilizing SMS and SAP, receivable month end schedules and bad debt allocation$$$%%%&&&Participate in the PPRP process, coaching and objective setting$$$%%%&&&Provide work direction and coordination for the team to ensure timely completion of work with multiple daily deadlines$$$%%%&&&Communicate and work closely with the IS group on system related issues to facilitate resolution$$$%%%&&&Participate in planning, and scheduling of system enhancement work related to the Finance & Accounting services workgroup$$$%%%&&&Identify, promote and implement receivable and credit card data management process improvements$$$%%%&&&Preparing monthly reporting, information, analysis, reconciliations and associated journal entries. Review variances and provide explanations.$$$%%%&&&Analyze processes and provide input on accounting policies and practices to accounting supervisors and managers$$$%%%&&&Communicate with banks and service providers to ensure the flow of information and settlement of accounts.$$$%%%&&&Analyze and reconcile assigned accounts to ensure timely flow and settlement$$$%%%&&&Research problems, answer inquiries, follow-up on outstanding issues with various departments and outside business partners for prompt settlement$$$%%%&&&Develop and maintain a high level of knowledge of Downstream Retail business and settlements, AR, incoming credit card and business partner payment processes$$$%%%&&&Understand and monitor SOX controls$$$%%%&&&Consolidate and generate the monthly business unit Key Performance Indicators (KPI) reporting$$$%%%&&&Liaise with Retail Operations, Marketing, Lubricant, Credit and Finance staff to resolve problems and coordinate receipt of information$$$%%%&&&Respond to ad hoc requests and participate in projects as required

POSITION SUMMARY:: This position is responsible for handling supply accounting, reconciliations, government compliance reporting relating to refining production, sales, inventories and purchases of Canadian refined products. The role requires an individual with accounting, analysis, and reconciliation experience as well as an understanding of cost accounting. This role interacts with the refinery and ethanol plant staff as well as the business units responsible for supply and logistics, and sales.
responsabilities: Working with various Operations staff to provide information and analyses that supports business activities$$$%%%&&&Prepare monthly accounting to record sale and purchase in accordance with the Supply contracts$$$%%%&&&Prepare accounting journal entries, reporting and variance analyses; ensuring sales and cost values are in accordance with contractual agreements.$$$%%%&&&Prepare monthly accounting reconciliations, statistics reports, government reports and reply to any queries.$$$%%%&&&Prepare sales invoice, supply purchase payment and freight payment for the supply contracts and services.$$$%%%&&&Provide supporting documents and reports as required for audit purposes.$$$%%%&&&Analyze and follow up on outstanding items on the assigned GL reconciliations to ensure outstanding items are reviewed, followed up and corrective action taken.$$$%%%&&&Assist with and/or work on system and process review and documentation. Assist with system testing, provide testing results.$$$%%%&&&Assist and work on completing special compliances reports, statistical reports, analysis and provide information regarding business activities.$$$%%%&&&Assist and work on special projects as they relate to Downstream Accounting.$$$%%%&&&Research problems, answer inquiries, follow-up on outstanding issues with various departments and outside companies for prompt settlement.$$$%%%&&&Identify and communicate opportunities to improve processes, eliminate reporting duplication and streamline reporting

POSITION SUMMARY:: The Senior Market Risk Analyst is an integral part of establishing a new energy risk management function charged with establishing and providing oversight to policies, procedures, risk measures, analysis and reporting on Husky Energy's portfolio of natural gas, crude and product assets. Focus will be on modeling exposures of the asset portfolio, delivering clear analysis and interpretation to key stakeholders.
responsabilities: Ensure all portfolio exposures are captured and appropriately modeled and reported$$$%%%&&&Identify and capture any additional market risk exposure that fall outside the risk capture system$$$%%%&&&Ensure all physical assets and transactions have receive the proper granularity and treatment within the risk system$$$%%%&&&Provide daily and monthly reporting and analysis on the asset portfolio$$$%%%&&&Ensure best practices for exposure and PnL capture with appropriate documentation are in place$$$%%%&&&Ensure proper monitoring and reporting of limits and corporate policies$$$%%%&&&Provide validation of all market price curves$$$%%%&&&Support risk system implementation and maintenance$$$%%%&&&Provide mentoring to other Business Analysts$$$%%%&&&Maintain excellent working relations with the Commercial and Finance teams

POSITION SUMMARY:: This is an intermediate to senior level position responsible for the finance support function for NGL Marketing. Reporting to the Finance Manager Midstream Infrastructure and Marketing, you will coordinate and consolidate management reporting, forecasting and business planning information ensuring standardized processes and reporting are employed. Specifically, you will perform business analytical and accounting functions, assure business processes and controls with respect to management reporting, forecasting and business planning are operating effectively, contribute to business unit initiatives, and function as focal point on corporate processes with a variety of groups. You will provide support to Marketing in managing the financial performance of the business.
responsabilities: Provide input into system and process improvements to enhance information provided to the marketing business and participate in developing and implementing standardize information and reporting processes$$$%%%&&&Liaise with business operations to provide commentary on variances highlighted in standard management reports, including economic income cost reports and position reports$$$%%%&&&Provide analysis to support Management Discussion and Analysis and press release information$$$%%%&&&Interpret results of business unit reporting as received by Accounting Services and develop qualitative explanations for discussion$$$%%%&&&Work with the business to identify and assist in implementation of corrective actions to close variances$$$%%%&&&Provide support in the preparation and submission of Sales, COGS, Expense, and SG&A budgets$$$%%%&&&Provide support in the preparation and submission of quarterly forecast and mid-year update$$$%%%&&&Consolidate and generate the monthly Business Unit report$$$%%%&&&Assist in economic evaluations, modeling and analysis$$$%%%&&&Conduct analysis and modeling in support of long range strategic planning, acquisitions, and new initiatives$$$%%%&&&Ensure accounting structures in SAP are appropriate and consistent$$$%%%&&&Provide finance and accounting services (which include accruals, allocations, intercompany transactions, preparation and analysis of business unit financial statements etc.)$$$%%%&&&Provide capital program stewardship$$$%%%&&&Provide fixed asset accounting expertise in support of structuring AFE's, approve financial setup of AFE, facilitate timely creation of AFE supplements, provide direction to AFE technician in the systems setup of AFE's and review cost reports$$$%%%&&&Liaise with the Business Partners to obtain approvals related to JV AFE's$$$%%%&&&Investigate and analyze disputed charges related to joint venture partner agreements and coordinate the efforts of multiple departments to resolve$$$%%%&&&Prepare and post required journal entries$$$%%%&&&Maintain effective governance, risk and compliance, including the implementation of control activities and provide assurance as to whether business controls are in place and operating effectively$$$%%%&&&Identify business practice and process improvement opportunities$$$%%%&&&Work with Finance Manager to identify impact of Corporate initiatives on business unit finance$$$%%%&&&Respond to ad hoc requests and participate in ad hoc projects as required

POSITION SUMMARY:: In this role you will be responsible for the analysis of operating costs and processing fees for the purpose of calculating 13th month equalizations on Husky operated facilities. POSITION SUMMARY:: Reporting to the Finance Manager Heavy Oil and Gas, you will coordinate and consolidate management reporting, forecasting, and business planning information. Thereby ensuring standardized processes and reporting are employed across the Heavy Oil Business Unit. Specifically, you will perform business analytical and accounting functions, and assure business processes and controls all adhered with respect to management reporting. You will ensure forecasting and business planning are operating effectively. You will contribute to business unit initiatives, and function as focal point for corporate processes with a variety of groups.
responsabilities: Provide Business Unit financial analysis and support for Heavy Oil and Gas (HOG)$$$%%%&&&Provide assurance that consolidated business unit financial statements align with business variances highlighted in standard management reports, including capital cost reports and operating cost management reports$$$%%%&&&Interpret results of business unit reporting as received by Finance Analysts to identify and assist in implementation of corrective actions to close variances$$$%%%&&&Provide financial information in support of consolidated business Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for HOG$$$%%%&&&Provide support in the preparation and submission of Capital, Operating cost and SG&A budgets across HOG$$$%%%&&&Provide finance and accounting services (which include accruals, allocations, inter-company transactions, preparation and analysis of business unit financial statements etc.)$$$%%%&&&Act as the focal point for corporate initiatives and process improvement projects providing leadership to the Finance Analysts and coordinating activities as appropriate$$$%%%&&&Prepare and post required journal entries$$$%%%&&&Support the business in identifying and managing operational risk within the scope of Upstream accounting$$$%%%&&&Facilitate project post-mortems$$$%%%&&&Maintain effective governance, risk and compliance, including the implementation of control POSITION SUMMARY:: - As the Business Analyst, you will be a key member of the Atlantic Region, Business Performance, Information and Reporting team responsible for developing, maintaining and updating long range plans, and reporting performance against those plans. Production forecasting, along with monitoring and reporting on key business metrics for the Atlantic Region, will also be major components of this role.  - In this position you will regularly interact with executive and management levels to answer questions, explain/interpret data, provide additional detail, and clarify information provided in various reports. POSITION SUMMARY:: Reporting to the Finance Manager Heavy Oil and Gas, you will coordinate and consolidate management reporting, forecasting, and business planning information. Thereby ensuring standardized processes and reporting are employed across the Heavy Oil Business Unit. Specifically, you will perform business analytical and accounting functions, and assure business processes and controls all adhered with respect to management reporting. You will ensure forecasting and business planning are operating effectively. You will contribute to business unit initiatives, and function as focal point for corporate processes with a variety of groups.
responsabilities: Provide Business Unit financial analysis and support for Heavy Oil and Gas (HOG)$$$%%%&&&Provide assurance that consolidated business unit financial statements align with business activities and that they are in accordance with accounting policies$$$%%%&&&Ensure standardized processes and reports are employed across HOG for management reporting, forecasting and budgeting$$$%%%&&&Ensure accounting structures in SAP are appropriate and consistent across HOG$$$%%%&&&Liaise with Finance Analysts to consolidate, analyze and provide commentary on consolidated variances highlighted in standard management reports, including capital cost reports and operating cost management reports$$$%%%&&&Interpret results of business unit reporting as received by Accounting Services and develop qualitative explanations for discussion$$$%%%&&&Provide analysis to support Management Discussion and Analysis and press release information$$$%%%&&&Work with the Finance Analysts to identify and assist in implementation of corrective actions to close variances$$$%%%&&&Provide financial information in support of consolidated business Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for HOG$$$%%%&&&Provide support in the preparation and submission of Capital, Operating cost and SG&A budgets across HOG$$$%%%&&&Provide finance and accounting services (which include accruals, allocations, inter-company transactions, preparation and analysis of business unit financial statements etc.)$$$%%%&&&Act as the focal point for corporate initiatives and process improvement projects providing leadership to the Finance Analysts and coordinating activities as appropriate$$$%%%&&&Prepare and post required journal entries$$$%%%&&&Support the business in identifying and managing operational risk within the scope of Upstream accounting$$$%%%&&&Facilitate project post-mortems$$$%%%&&&Maintain effective governance, risk and compliance, including the implementation of control activities and provide assurance as to whether business controls are in place and operating effectively$$$%%%&&&Identify business practice and process improvement opportunities$$$%%%&&&Work with Finance Manager to identify impact of Corporate initiatives on business unit finance$$$%%%&&&Respond to ad hoc requests and participate in ad hoc projects as required

CA_REQD: A Bachelor of Commerce or equivalent with a specialization in Accounting/Finance

CP_ASSET: Canadian Association of Petroleum Production Accounting (CAPPA) certification would be an asset

POSITION SUMMARY:: This position is responsible for managing credit risks inherent in the midstream commodity transactions. This include identifying, defining, and mitigating credit risks by conducting analyses of financial position and related information of transacting parties. It also involves recommending credit limits and credit terms of sale as well as securities and assurances that are needed from customers and/or counterparties, including negotiating thereof. This role maintains close working relationship with the Marketing group and counterparties to manage the assigned portfolio.
responsabilities: Perform credit assessments on assigned portfolio through analysis of financial statements and related information to recommend credit limits and identify credit risks consistent with the company's credit policies.$$$%%%&&&Identify, recommend, and obtain securities or assurances from counterparties and customers necessary to mitigate credit risks. Ensures required securities or assurances are in place to mitigate risks.$$$%%%&&&Coordinate with Marketing and counterparties or customers to identify and establish credit limits required by the business.$$$%%%&&&Monitor compliance to approved credit limits by identifying and reporting credit policy deviations including over limit situations.$$$%%%&&&Assist in the negotiation of the financial aspects of General terms and Conditions relating to commodity contracts.$$$%%%&&&Develop, recommend, and utilize effective assessment techniques in managing credit risks and facilitating transactions.$$$%%%&&&Build strong working relationship with commodities Marketing group.

This includes direction and planning as well as operational and functional support for this role on a day to day basis.$$$%%%&&&Limit management and control including the granting of bulge facilities as required from time to time to support sales.$$$%%%&&&Maintaining reserves for bad debt at levels adequate for the HMSC portfolio.
